org.perfidix.element

Class AbstractMethodArrangement

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.perfidix.element.AbstractMethodArrangement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<BenchmarkElement>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NoMethodArrangement, SequentialMethodArrangement, ShuffleMethodArrangement

    public abstract class AbstractMethodArrangement
extends Object
implements Iterable<BenchmarkElement>
    This method defines an order for the execution of all methods. A collection with definitly benchmarkable methods is given in, shuffled in a way and returned as an iterator. The kind of shuffling is set by the enum KindOfArrangement. ordered with the help of inheriting classes.
    Author:
    Sebastian Graf, University of Konstanz

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMethodArrangement

        protected AbstractMethodArrangement(List<BenchmarkElement> elements)
        Constructor which takes all benchmarkable methods. These methods are afterwards shuffled with the help of the implementing class. Note that the elements are fix after the arrangement.
        Parameters:
        elements - definitly benchmarkable objects.

        Returns:
        the arranged methods.

      • getMethodArrangement

        public static final AbstractMethodArrangement getMethodArrangement(List<BenchmarkElement> elements,
                                             KindOfArrangement kind)
        Factory method to get the method arrangement for a given set of classes. The kind of arrangement is set by an instance of the enum KindOfArrangement.
        Parameters:
        elements - to be benched
        kind - for the method arrangement
        Returns:
        the arrangement, mainly an iterator
